an6.39:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
an6.39:1.3: Greed, hate, and delusion are sources that give rise to deeds.
an6.39:1.4: Greed doesn’t give rise to contentment.
an6.39:1.5: Rather, greed just gives rise to greed.
an6.39:1.6: Hate doesn’t give rise to love.
an6.39:1.7: Rather, hate just gives rise to hate.
an6.39:1.8: Delusion doesn’t give rise to understanding.
an6.39:1.9: Rather, delusion just gives rise to delusion.
an6.39:1.10: It’s not because of deeds born of greed, hate, and delusion that gods, humans, or those in any other good places are found.
an6.39:1.11: Rather, it’s because of deeds born of greed, hate, and delusion that hell, the animal realm, the ghost realm, or any other bad places are found.
an6.39:1.12: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.
an6.39:2.1: Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
an6.39:2.3: Contentment, love, and understanding are sources that give rise to deeds.
an6.39:2.4: Contentment doesn’t give rise to greed.
an6.39:2.5: Rather, contentment just gives rise to contentment.
an6.39:2.6: Love doesn’t give rise to hate.
an6.39:2.7: Rather, love just gives rise to love.
an6.39:2.8: Understanding doesn’t give rise to delusion.
an6.39:2.9: Rather, understanding just gives rise to understanding.
an6.39:2.10: It’s not because of deeds born of contentment, love, and understanding that hell, the animal realm, the ghost realm, or any other bad places are found.
an6.39:2.11: Rather, it’s because of deeds born of contentment, love, and understanding that gods, humans, or those in any other good places are found.
an6.39:2.12: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.”
